description.value:
This identifier profile defines a patient internal identifier in an Australian context. A patient internal identifier is assigned to a patient by an application (e.g. practice management system or a cloud-based electronic medical record). Its purpose is to uniquely identify a patient within that application.
While a patient internal identifier can be exchanged with other applications, its scope for sharing is limited. This exchange typically occurs for context-specific patient matching (e.g. a patient internal identifier included in a pathology request can be returned in the associated pathology report). Implementers should be aware when sharing a patient internal identifier that it is only unique to the assigning application, unlike a Medical Record Number (MRN) that is unique within an institution.

definition.value: Identifier assigned to a patient within an application, for example a practice management system, that is used to uniquely identify a patient within that application.
